answers.answer: I was induced at 37 weeks bc of being diabetic among other issues. They tested his lungs to make sure he would be ok and what they thought was a 8 pound baby ended up being ten. But he has had no issues and is actually beyond healthy.
It is recommended. Being induced for medical reasons is important. If they feel it should be done, I'd listen! 37 weeks is full term and perfectly fine for baby to be born. Don't worry :)
Thanks. I was just checking to make sure. I just want him to be healthy.
We're you able to have him natural or a c-section?

They tried inducing me but my body couldn't be jump started into labor so had to do a c section. It wasn't bad at all though. I'm sure all will go wonderfully for you though momma. No need to worry :)
Are you gestational diabetic or were you diabetic before the pregnancy? Just curious
Oh goodness. And I was a diabetic before I got.

Oh okay. I was just curious because I have gestational diabetes and I know my doctor won't induce until 40+ weeks. So I was curious.But don't stress a lot of women give birth vaginally just fine when induced at 37 weeks. Just stay positive. Maybe as your doctor about evening primrose oil to soften your cervix maybe it will help.
Okay I'll ask him about that.

question: Okay so I'm 28 1/2 weeks pregnant with my little boy. I went to my diabetes doctor and I'm measuring two weeks further and the baby is a pound bigger than what he's supposed to be. He wants to induce me somewhere around 37 weeks but I'm not sure if that's a good idea. This is my first child so I'm not really sure...
title: Being induced because I'm a diabetic....
